newsitem.title: SPAIN: Big stocks revive flagging Madrid bourse at close.
newsitem.headline: Big stocks revive flagging Madrid bourse at close.

text.p: Madrid stocks closed flat on Wednesday after recouping early losses as bigger shares staged a late term recovery.
Dealers said U.S. factors, including publication of the Federal Reserve's Beige Book on interest rate outlooks, would have the biggest influence on Madrid stocks short term.
The General index fell 0.19 points, 0.05 percent, to 351.95 and the Ibex-35 lost 2.37 points, 0.06 percent, to 4,001.34.
Repsol gained 60 pesetas, 1.46 percent, to 4,160 with more than 570,000 shares traded, regaining ground after a temporary price slide due to announced petrol price changes
"The session was pretty uninteresting, although later on there was more buying in companies like Repsol that helped the indices and the ambience is lightly positive," one dealer said.
Trading volume was off a bit from Tuesday with 19.0 billion pesetas in business done.
Electricity firm Iberdrola came under pressure from foreign sellers and shed 15 pesetas, 1.3 percent, to 1,120 with 2.6 million shares traded.
